At NTU, I had the privilege of working under the guidance of Prof. Dusit (Tao) Niyato. My time at SUTD was spent collaborating with Prof. Zehui Xiong. While at CUFE, I worked closely with Prof. Jianming Zhu and Prof. Sheng Gao.
advisor.research: My research interests lie in the areas of Web 3.0, blockchain security, stablecoin and Federated multi-modal LLMs.
advisor.lab: I created Matrix Lab, affiliated with the Beijing Advanced Innovation Center for Future Blockchain and Privacy Computing. advisor.vision: Through these integrated research streams, we strive to push the boundaries of AI and blockchain technology, moving closer to the vision of a decentralized, intelligent value network that exceeds conventional financial systems.

items.title: Team Wins Second Prize at 4th National Blockchain Competition
items.summary: On December 19, 2025, the Ke Entropy Technology team traveled to Shanghai to participate in the 4th CCF National Blockchain Technology and Innovation Application Competition (CCF CBCC 2025). After fierce competition, the team won the second prize in the championship finals. The competition attracted 490 students from over 180 universities nationwide, with 101 works submitted. Our team successfully advanced to the finals representing Beihang University and achieved excellent results.
items.content:
On December 19, 2025, the Ke Entropy Technology team represented Beihang University at the 4th CCF National Blockchain Technology and Innovation Application Competition (CCF CBCC 2025) championship finals in Shanghai, winning the national second prize.

Competition Overview
The 4th National Blockchain Technology and Innovation Application Competition officially launched on July 5, 2025. With extensive promotion and organized coordination by the competition committee, it attracted 490 students from over 180 universities nationwide. After rigorous screening, 101 works entered the evaluation phase. Through comprehensive scoring, 24 contestants successfully advanced to the finals.

Competition Journey
09:00 Group Stage: Participated in the finals group stage, successfully advancing to the championship round with excellent performance
14:00 Final Presentation: Faced the championship jury for in-depth project presentation and defense
17:00 Award Ceremony: Won the national second prize at the 4th National Blockchain Technology and Innovation Application Competition

Technical Innovation
Our competition entry fully demonstrated Matrix Lab's research achievements in blockchain underlying technology, AI-empowered blockchain security, and Web3 ecosystem. By combining cutting-edge academic research with practical application scenarios, our solution received high recognition from expert judges.

Team Message
This award is not only recognition of our team's technical capabilities but also affirmation of our continuous innovation and pursuit of excellence. We will continue to deepen our blockchain technology research and contribute to the healthy development of the Web3 industry. Thanks to Beihang University, Matrix Lab, and all the teachers and partners who supported us!

items.title: Ke Entropy Strategic Ecosystem Launch
items.summary: Ke Entropy announces its 'One Core, Two Wings' strategy. With Matrix Lab as the technological core, we drive the dual development of the MATRIXLAB EXCHANGE financial platform and the 'Immortal Ledger' metaverse game. We aim to break boundaries and build a complete Web3 ecosystem integrating fundamental research, asset management, and immersive experiences.
items.content:
Ke Entropy Technology officially announces its 'One Core, Two Wings' panoramic ecosystem strategy, marking a new stage from single technical R&D to diversified ecosystem construction.

1. Strategic Core: Matrix Lab
As the technological engine of the ecosystem, Matrix Lab will focus on next-generation blockchain consensus algorithms, cross-chain interoperability protocols, and Zero-Knowledge Proof (ZK) privacy solutions. The lab aims to provide high-performance, high-security infrastructure support for the entire ecosystem and export technical standards to the industry.

2. Financial Wing: MATRIXLAB EXCHANGE
This is not just a trading platform, but a next-generation digital asset management center. We will integrate institutional-grade risk control systems, AI-driven quantitative analysis tools, and seamless fiat on/off ramps to provide users with a secure, transparent, and intelligent trading experience. All assets are verifiable on-chain, eliminating black-box operations.

3. Entertainment Wing: Immortal Ledger
We are redefining GameFi. 'Immortal Ledger' uses dynamic NFT technology and Autonomous World concepts to build an on-chain civilization evolved by players. Here, asset ownership belongs entirely to players, and the economic system is automatically regulated by smart contracts, realizing true 'Play to Own'.

In the future, Ke Entropy will continue to break the boundaries between virtual and reality, connecting the real world with the digital future through technological innovation.

items.title: Compliance and Security Statement
items.summary: Adhering to 'Technology for Good, Compliance First,' we focus on blockchain R&D, security audits, and decentralized protocol design. We strictly comply with global regulations. All financial-related operations run within compliance frameworks, ensuring secure and transparent standards for the industry.
items.content:
Ke Entropy Technology always regards compliance and security as the lifeline of corporate development. Regarding recent market concerns, we hereby state:

1. Clear Business Boundaries
Our company engages solely in blockchain underlying technology research, software development, and technical consulting services. We do not participate in, assist, or organize any form of illegal digital currency trading activities. All public-facing products (such as games and tools) comply with the laws and regulations of the operating regions.

2. No Stablecoin Issuance
Regarding market rumors, we explicitly state: Ke Entropy Technology has no plans to issue stablecoins on its own at present or in the near future. Our stablecoin research is limited to academic and algorithmic model exploration, aiming to provide theoretical references for the industry.

3. Strict Risk Control System
Our financial-related businesses (such as future compliant trading services) will integrate top-tier international KYC/AML systems and undergo regular security audits by authoritative third-party institutions. We commit to implementing a 100% reserve system for user assets and disclosing on-chain addresses for supervision.

Ke Entropy is willing to work with regulators and industry partners to promote the development of the Web3 industry in a more standardized, transparent, and healthy direction.

web3-security-trends-2025.title: Web3 Security Trends 2025: From Attack Vectors to Defense Strategies
web3-security-trends-2025.excerpt: In-depth analysis of major security threats in Web3 for 2025, including smart contract vulnerabilities, cross-chain bridge attacks, phishing scams, and professional defense recommendations.
web3-security-trends-2025.author: Matrix Lab Security Team
web3-security-trends-2025.keywords: Web3 security, smart contract vulnerabilities, blockchain security, cross-chain attacks, security audit
web3-security-trends-2025.authorBio: Matrix Lab Security Team focuses on blockchain security research and provides security audit services for multiple well-known projects.
web3-security-trends-2025.content:
Introduction

With the rapid development of the Web3 ecosystem, security issues are becoming increasingly prominent. In 2024, we witnessed multiple major security incidents with losses exceeding billions of dollars. This article will analyze the main security trends for 2025.

Major Threat Types

1. Smart Contract Vulnerabilities

Smart contract vulnerabilities remain the primary attack vector. Common vulnerabilities include:

  • Reentrancy attacks
  • Integer overflow/underflow
  • Access control flaws
  • Logic errors

2. Cross-Chain Bridge Attacks

Cross-chain bridges have become prime targets for hackers as they lock significant assets. Attack methods include bypassing validation mechanisms and signature forgery.

3. Social Engineering Attacks

Phishing websites, fake project teams, Discord/Telegram scams are becoming increasingly sophisticated.

Defense Strategies

Code Audits

Professional smart contract audits are essential before mainnet deployment. Choose qualified third-party audit firms.

Multi-Signature

Implement multi-signature mechanisms for critical operations to avoid single points of failure.

Real-time Monitoring

Deploy on-chain monitoring systems to detect anomalous transactions and potential attacks promptly.

Conclusion

Web3 security is a continuously evolving field. Only by staying vigilant and adopting multi-layered defense strategies can we effectively protect asset security.

smart-contract-audit-guide.title: Complete Guide to Smart Contract Security Audits: From Beginner to Expert
smart-contract-audit-guide.excerpt: Comprehensive introduction to smart contract security audit processes, methods, and tools. Whether you're a developer or project owner, this guide helps you understand how to ensure contract security.
smart-contract-audit-guide.author: Seal Wax
smart-contract-audit-guide.keywords: smart contract audit, Solidity security, code audit, security testing, vulnerability detection
smart-contract-audit-guide.authorBio: Founder of Ke Entropy Technology, dedicated to blockchain security research and Web3 technology innovation.
smart-contract-audit-guide.content:
What is Smart Contract Auditing?

Smart contract auditing is a systematic security review of blockchain smart contract code to identify potential security vulnerabilities, logic errors, and performance issues.

Audit Process

1. Requirements Analysis

Understand project background, business logic, and security requirements.

2. Code Review

Manual code review to check for common vulnerability patterns.

3. Automated Testing

Use tools like Slither and Mythril for automated scanning.

4. Dynamic Testing

Conduct actual attack simulations on test networks.

5. Report Writing

Document findings and remediation recommendations in detail.

Common Tools

  • Slither: Static analysis tool
  • Mythril: Symbolic execution tool
  • Echidna: Fuzzing tool
  • Manticore: Symbolic execution engine

Best Practices

  1. Follow Solidity coding standards
  2. Use verified libraries (like OpenZeppelin)
  3. Implement comprehensive unit testing
  4. Conduct multiple audit rounds
  5. Establish bug bounty programs

defi-risk-management.title: DeFi Risk Management: How to Protect Assets in Decentralized Finance
defi-risk-management.excerpt: Explore major risk types in DeFi, including smart contract risks, liquidity risks, oracle risks, and provide practical risk management strategies.
defi-risk-management.author: Matrix Lab Research Team
defi-risk-management.keywords: DeFi risks, decentralized finance, liquidity risk, oracle attacks, risk management
defi-risk-management.authorBio: Matrix Lab Research Team focuses on DeFi ecosystem research, providing professional risk analysis for investors.
defi-risk-management.content:
Major DeFi Risks

1. Smart Contract Risk

Smart contract code may contain vulnerabilities leading to fund loss. Even audited contracts may have undiscovered issues.

2. Liquidity Risk

During market volatility, you may be unable to exit positions timely or suffer significant slippage losses.

3. Oracle Risk

DeFi protocols rely on oracles for price data; oracle manipulation can cause protocol anomalies.

4. Governance Risk

Malicious proposals or governance attacks may change protocol rules, harming user interests.

Risk Management Strategies

Diversification

Don't put all funds in a single protocol; diversify across multiple verified projects.

Choose Audited Protocols

Prioritize protocols audited by multiple reputable firms.

Use Insurance Products

Consider purchasing DeFi insurance like Nexus Mutual, InsurAce, etc.

Set Stop-Loss

Implement automatic stop-loss mechanisms for high-risk positions.

Continuous Monitoring

Regularly check protocol TVL, audit reports, and community feedback.

Recommended Tools

  • DeFi Pulse: Track DeFi protocol data
  • DeFi Safety: Protocol security ratings
  • Zapper / Zerion: Asset management dashboards
